==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Shōjo}}
[[File:Polin021.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|少女}} (''shōjo''): a '''girl''' holding a puppy.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|しょう|じょ|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょうじょ}} compound {{m|ltc|少女|tr=*shiɛu *njiǔ}}. Compare modern {{cog|zh|少女|tr=shàonǚ}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|しょ|うじょ}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɕo̞ːd͡ʑo̞]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しょうじょ|hhira=せうぢよ}}

# a ([[young]], [[little]]) [[girl]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=しょうじょ|anime|manga}} a style of [[anime]] and [[manga]] made for young women, [[shojo]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|少女歌劇|しょうじょかげき|shōjo kageki}}: a kind of traditional Japanese light [[drama]] with no male actors and mostly young girls playing the parts
* {{ja-l|少女趣味|しょうじょしゅみ|shōjo shumi}}: [[hobby|hobbies]] or [[interest]]s common to young girls
* {{ja-l|少女時代|しょうじょじだい|shōjo jidai}}: [[girlhood]], one's [[girlhood]]
{{der-bottom}}

=====See also=====
{{der-top|See also}}
* {{ja-l|子供|こども|kodomo}}: child
* {{ja-l|処女|しょじょ|shojo}}: a female virgin, a maiden
* {{ja-l|女性|じょせい|josei}}: the [[feminine]] [[gender]]; [[female]]; [[woman]]
* {{ja-l|少年|しょうねん|shōnen}}: young boy
* {{ja-l|青年|せいねん|seinen}}: young man
* {{ja-l|男性|だんせい|dansei}}: the [[masculine]] [[gender]]; [[male]]; [[man]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|おと|め|yomi=kun}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=おとめ}}. Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=おとめ|乙|tr1=oto|t1=young, little|女|tr2=me|t2=female, girl}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> Compare {{m|ja|男|tr=otoko||man}}, originally meaning "young boy".

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|乙女}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|n|お|と|め}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[o̞to̞me̞]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おとめ}}

# a young [[woman]], [[adult]] but [[unmarried]]: a [[maiden]]
# a [[girl]]
# a [[female]] [[virgin]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=おとめ|mythology}} a [[celestial]] [[maiden]], a [[fairy]], a [[nymph]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=おとめ|Shinto}} a young woman [[dancer]] performing at the {{l|ja|五節|tr=''Gosechi''}} ceremony in the eleventh [[lunar month]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|少女さび|おとめさび|otomesabi}}: behavior appropriate to an adult unmarried woman
* {{ja-l|少女の頭|おとめのかしら|otome no kashira}}: alternate term for {{ja-l|萱藻海苔}}, {{ja-l|カヤモノリ||kayamo nori}}, a type of [[sea vegetable]] in order ''[[Scytosiphonales]]'', of class ''[[Phaeophyceae]]'' (brown [[algae]]), used to make [[nori]]
* {{ja-l|少女子|おとめこ|otomeko}}: an unmarried young woman; a girl or young woman who dances [[kagura]] at a [[shrine]]; a [[miko]]
* {{ja-l|少女心|おとめごころ|otomegokoro}}: a girl's [[innocence]], a girl's [[sensitive]] [[nature]]
* {{ja-l|少女文楽|おとめぶんらく|otome bunraku}}: a kind of one-person [[puppet show]] performed by girls or young women
* {{ja-l|少女巫|おとめみこ|otome miko}}: a female [[miko]]
{{der-bottom}}

=====See also=====
* {{ja-l|男|おとこ|otoko}}: a [[man]]
